node.title: NZ food prices highest increase in a decade
node.description: StatsNZ says the increase comes down to the price of tomatoes almost doubling.
node.content: ["Food prices in Aotearoa have seen the highest increase in a decade according to new figures from StatsNZ", "StatsNZs annual food price evaluation shows the cost of food in supermarkets increased 4.5 percent in December 2021 year-on-year.\u00a0", "That increase is in part down to tomatoes. StatsNZ consumer prices manager Katrina Dewbery says tomatoes nearly doubled in price.\u00a0", "\"The weighted average price of 1kg of tomatoes increased from $3.33 in December 2020 to $6.61 in December 2021.\"", "StatsNZ says grocery foods had the biggest impact on the price rise, with its other main contributors being yoghurt, standard two-lite milk and fresh eggs.\u00a0", "Restaurant meals and ready-to-eat food prices increased 5.1 percent", "\"Households spend more on grocery food than on restaurant meals and ready-to-eat food,\" StatsNZ said.\u00a0"]
